intro: Lessingia ramulosa var. micradenia, commonly known as the narrow-leafless lessingia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are narrow and often reduced, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is a perennial species that thrives in well-drained environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
